MxCuBE Documentation¶

MXCuBE stands for Macromolecular Xtallography CUstomized Beamline Environment. The project started in 2005 at ESRF, since then it has been adopted by other institutes in Europe. In 2010, a collaboration agreement has been signed for the development of MXCuBE with the following partners:

  • ESRF
  • Soleil
  • Max lab
  • HZB
  • EMBL
  • Global Phasing Ltd.
  • ALBA
  • DESY

Latest news about the MXCuBE project can be found in the project website.

MXCuBE consist of separated data acquisition control layer and graphical user interface.

Data acquisition control

Data acquisition control is based on Hardware Objects as Python classes associated with a configuration XML file. Hardware Objects are instanciated by the Hardware Repository. Each Hardware Object should be based on an abstract class, defining a common API for MXCuBE. Then, implementation differs at each site depending on hardware and beamline specificities. See the Design Overview and Overview of features for more details.

Graphical user interface

MXCuBE has two graphical user interfaces:

  • Qt framework based GUI
  • Web based GUI
